item.title: UNESCO | Government guarantees that it will respond to concerns
item.description:
Macao will “follow up to the relevant resolutions” of UNESCO. In question is the requirement for environmental impact assessment for the construction of the viaduct between zones A and B of new landfills and information on the eastern east line. Experts point out that UNESCO recognition has boosted cultural tourism in the territory
Tomorrow, the 20th anniversary of the Entry of the Historic Center of Macau is celebrated on the World Heritage List of the United Nations Education, Science and Culture Organization (UNESCO). It runs until next Thursday, in Paris, the 47th Convention of the World Heritage Committee, where the mashes is represented by the Cultural Institute. At the end of last week, during the UNESCO Convention, the Committee issued a monitoring resolution to the State of Macao's Heritage Conservation. In addition to some compliments, the international institution calls for the comprehensive environmental impact assessment regarding the construction of the viaduct that will connect zones A and B of new landfills, especially a part that may violate the height restrictions around the guide headlight. The issue of buildings for ending the sidewalk of the guide and the construction of the Light Metro Line line were also topics on which the World Heritage Committee requested additional information, pointing out as a delivery time of all documentation on December 1, 2026, the Tribuna de Macao newspaper (JTM) reported. In a statement issued on Friday night, the Cultural Institute indicates that “it will follow relevant resolutions and submit to the UNESCO World Heritage Committee the documents related to the monitoring of relevant projects for analysis, according to the general communication mechanism in the past”. Documentation will be delivered through the state administration of China's cultural heritage. Unnatural The JTM also indicated that the UNESCO Committee enhances the commitments and efforts made in the Historic Center's safeguard and management plan, with a view to implementing previous requests from the international organization. However, it regrets that it was not heard, as requested, before it came into force in early June last year. In the statement on Friday, the IC does not mention the repair of the UNESCO Committee, but that it congratulates the MSAR authorities for the formal entry into force and the implementation of the safeguard and management plan and the work of conservation, monitoring, interpretation and exposure of Macao heritage. History and Game Experts consider that the classification of the historic center of Macau by UNESCO has boosted cultural tourism in the territory, supporting the diversification of an economy traditionally dependent on casinos, but warns of challenges in promoting heritage. Na Tcha's temple and the ruins of Sao Paulo are side by side in the historic center of Macau. Early in the morning, families pose to the chamber at the bottom of the iconic stone staircase of the ruins. “I like the sidewalk [Portuguese], it's special,” says Lusa Alina Wang, a Shanghai tourist. The eight -year -old son York Xiong adds: "The buildings are beautiful." Not everyone in the family, however, knows the story behind Macao's "former libris", reduced to the facade after fires. The patriarch, I read Zijian, was going to swear that it had been destroyed during World War II. Beside, another family, this from Xi'an, associates the image of the ruins with a Japanese bombardment in the Great War. 20 years ago, on July 15, 2005, the Historic Center of Macau, a set of 22 monuments that combines Portuguese and Chinese architecture, joined the UNESCO World Heritage list. This milestone for the city's heritage, Lusa tells the Directorate of Tourism Services (STD), brought more tourists to Macau, changing the profile of the visitor, who stopped crossing the border just to play. "This changed the image of Macao from a" city of the game "to a cultural destination, differentiating it in the Asia-Pacific region," said the STD. A study to STD visitors this year reveals that 53.3 percent of tourists arrive in the territory to visit the heritage, surpassing those who want to shop (33.7 percent) and those most interested in gastronomy (18.5 percent). For IP FEI Law, historian and former member of the Macao Cultural Heritage Council, the UNESCO Statute raised Macao's global profile. "The game has boosted the economy in the short term, culture should boost long -term growth," he told Lusa. Amusement park But if, on the one hand, the inscription of heritage came to help diversify the tourist's profile, you have to think of those who live in the city daily, noticed Ka Nok Lo, vice president of the Macao Heritage Ambassadors Association. In an interview with Lusa, the official warned of the need not to turn Macau “into a Disneyland”, defending the balance between tourism and the needs of residents. "Museums should serve the community, as are libraries, bookstores, not just tourists," he said. Ka stressed, on the other hand, that the visitors still remain the narrative that unites the various places distinguished by UNESCO. "There is no story that turns on these monuments," he said. The Macao government has as one of the main objectives to seek economic diversification, in order to reduce its dependence on the game industry through the development of new sectors. But the appeal of the casinos is unavoidable, such as the families of Shanghai and Xi'an have highlighted. The day after the Macao Historic Zone tour, the visit to the region would continue in the modern resorts of the game concentrated in the Cotai, highlighting the double role of Macao as a gaming destination and cultural heritage. item.title: ICBC | Missing banker with ties to ng lap seng
item.description:
Jiang Yisheng was president of the Macao representation of China's Industrial and Commercial Bank between 2018 and 2023, when the institution was distinguished with the Industrial and Commercial Medal. The banker is being investigated for relations with the Windsor Arch real estate project
Former President of the Macao Representation of the China Industrial and Commercial Bank (ICBC), Jiang Yisheng, is being investigated by the interior authorities, being in uncertain whereabouts due to facts practiced in Macao and calls with businessman NG Lap Seng. The news was advanced on Friday by the Caixin Global newspaper, a publication of the interior. Hours after the information, which initially indicated that Jiang was incontabinently and missing, the Central Disciplinary Inspection Commission confirmed that Jiang Yisheng is being investigated for “severe violation of discipline and law,” a term normally used in corruption -related investigations. In addition to the Central Committee on Disciplinary Inspection, the investigation also involves the Zhuhai Municipal Supervision Committee. According to Global Caixi, the investigation aimed at Jiang Yisheng deals with real estate loans approved by the Macao ICBC, especially the luxury project Windsor Arch, built ahead of the Jockey Club and in which several local entrepreneurs participated. This was a project developed by NG Lag Seng, then president of the group Sun Kian IP, and was also part of the investigation within the judicial case that resulted in the judgment of former public works directors, Jaime Carion and Li Canfeng. Also Ng Kei Nin, son of NG Lap Seng, one of the company's directors, was implied in the case. Both were convicted in Macao to comply with prison sentences. Growing Global caxin indicates that the investigation comes at a time when ICBC Macao has an increase in evil credit, ie the loans that have been approved to debtors who later cannot pay debts. The Macao ICBC will also have filed shares against the goods of NG Lap Seng and NG Kei Nin due to money borrowed to the not returned business group. Among the assets that are the target of seizure are about 80 parks of parking, 40 offices and bank deposits and actions on the stock exchange evaluated by more than 1.7 million patacas. Jiang Yisheng, who was president of the Macao ICBC between 2018 and 2023, was also aimed at a bank's internal disciplinary proceedings, which began in early 2024 due to loan approval without the necessary guarantees. In 2019, during the presidency of Jiang Yisheng the Macau ICBC was distinguished by Fernando Chui Sai On with the medal of industrial and commercial merit. Jiang Yisheng received the distinction of the then chief executive. Alongside Banco da China, China's construction bank and China's Agricultural Bank, China's Industrial and Commercial Bank is part of the group of four major interior banks, considered as the main ones in the country. In addition, ICBC is a state bank.

item.title: Water | Ordient Tight supervision after recent scandals
item.description:
The four locally bottled touched water episodes that failed quality and security tests led the deputy to ask for greater control of the products in Macau and to ask for new ways to test the waters
Deputy Song Pek Kei appeals to the authorities to reinforce the water quality control measures in the territory. This is how the Legislator linked to the Fujian community reacted to recent locally bottled waters who do not comply with quality or safety standards. At the interpetement, the deputy wrote to expect authorities to contribute to ensure the quality of bottled water in Macao and correct existing inspection failures. And one of the problems identified by the deputy involves the way water quality control is done: “Although the institute for municipal issues regularly make random inspections, most of these inspections are made through analyzes to water samples, so the safety of the production line and water -recycled carboys is not controlled,” wrote Song. Since early May, authorities have revealed at least four cases where different brands of bottled and distributed water in Macao did not meet standards and quality. The targeted brands are the Iceblue water, from the Oi Kou Pou Factory, brand Ieong Iat Tat, from the factory of the same name, the water Sun, from Miram Group, and NK water from the NK drinking water factory. Under these cases, which were detected by AMI, Song Pek Kei acknowledged that measures were taken to deal with the different situations. However, it criticized the lack of a broader quality and safety control mechanism. Repeated cases The deputy linked to the Fujian community was concerned about having been identified "so many cases" in a short time, which contributes to a "social concern" in the face of the supplied water. Song Pek Kei writes that another of the population's concerns aims at the water available in public spaces, in which the carboys often do not identify the water supplier, do not present the results of the latest water quality tests, nor the recommended date of water consumption. In addition, Song wants the government to make available in public spaces the date of the last cleaning of the machines that provide water from the carboys. For this reason, the legislator expects the government to ask the water suppliers to fix labels with information in the water carboys. In addition, the deputy asks the machines to be clean and kept regularly, especially in public spaces and services, such as schools, hospitals and homes for the elderly. One of the waters aimed at quality problems has seen the M-Mark certification, a seal of quality administration, has been suspended. On this aspect, Song Pek Kei considered that this type of certification must always be dependent on quality tests so that products in Macau can develop a stronger reputation.

item.title: Finance | Public accounts with loss before the reinforcement of social support
item.description:
Public accounts presented in June losses of 289.4 million patacas, a record contrary to the trend since the beginning of the year. Between January and June, the MSAR has an surplus of 11.4 billion of patacas
Public accounts show a loss of 289.4 million patacas in June, even before a budget revision to reinforce social support. However, when the period between January and July is considered, data from the Directorate of Finance Services (DSF) show a surplus in public accounts of 11.4 billion. This value represents a 2.5 percent drop compared to the end of May, when Macau had a surplus of 11.7 billion patacas. Still, the surplus of the city between January and June was 40.3 percent higher than in the same period last year and is already higher than the government forecast for the year 2025: 6.83 billion Patacas. Macao closed 2024 with an surplus of 15.8 billion patacas, more than twice the one recorded the previous year. Macao's public expense fell 8.2 percent in the first half of the year, compared to the same period of 2024, to 41.4 billion patacas. The only reason for the fall was spending on social support and subsidies, which decreased 17.7 percent to 20.7 billion patacas. But the Legislative Assembly approved on Wednesday a government proposal to increase by 2.86 billion the expenses provided for in the budget to reinforce social support. The review includes the creation of a subsidy, totaling 54,000 patacas, for children up to 3 years, to raise the lowest birth in the world. Smaller recipes Macao current revenue also fell 0.95 percent in the first half of the year to 52.3 billion patacas. The main reason for the decrease was a drop of 62.3 percent to 520 million patacas, in the “property income”, a heading that includes the revenue of land concessions. On the contrary, the revenues of taxes on the game - which represent 86.4 percent of the total - rose 1 percent to 45.3 billion patacas. The six city game operators pay a 35 percent direct tax on the game's revenues, 2.4 percent for the Social Security Fund and urban and tourist development, and 1.6 percent delivered to the Macao Foundation for cultural, educational, scientific, academics and philanthropic purposes. The total revenues of Macao casinos reached 118.8 billion patacas in the first half of the year, 4.4 percent than in the same period of 2024. On April 15, Sam Hou Fai admitted to fear a budget deficit in 2025, due to the slowdown in game revenues.

item.title: Sao Tome and Prince | Relationship with China is discreet, but strategic
item.description:
On Saturday, 50 years of the independence of Sao Tome and Principe were celebrated. The future advances to the rhythm of diplomatic relations with other Portuguese speaking countries. For academic Cátia Miriam Costa, the African country and China are strategic partners, despite the description of the relationship between both
Researcher Cátia Miriam Costa considers that the relationship between Sao Tome and Principe and China remains discreet, despite being almost celebrating a decade, with growing Beijing's strategic interest in the position of the archipelago in the South Atlantic. "Since neither country nor another talks much about the subject, we end up not realizing the depth of the relationship well. But I believe it is not yet a very deep relationship," the researcher at the Center for International Studies of ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, noted to the Lusa. The geostrategic position of the archipelago, located in the Gulf of Guinea,, however, feeds Beijing's interest, namely in the context of the Chinese bet on the expansion of logistics and sea corridors in the South Atlantic. "Sao Tome, if it is not a very important port in logistical terms, is a relevant port for control, for example, of piracy, threats. Therefore, this position also certainly reflected by Beijing," he explained. The restoration of formal ties in 2016, after two decades of Taiwan's recognition by Sao Tome, was a “pragmatic” decision of the African country, and a trump card for Beijing Diplomacy, which always maintained “open channels”, even during the period of removal, Cátia Miriam Costa explained. "The relationship with China is more fruitful because it brings other counterparts," explained the researcher. "It was also for these counterparts that [in 1997] Sao Tome exchanged the Popular Republic of China for Taiwan, because at that time the Popular Republic of China was a developing country. So it didn't have to offer what Taiwan had, which was perfectly integrated into the international market," he said. A VOLTE-FACE In December 2016, Sao Tome officially announced the establishment of relations with the Popular Republic of China, ending the recognition of Taiwan. The decision caused the immediate cancellation of the scholarships offered by Taiwan to St.-Tome students, many of whom were eventually integrated into the other Chinese universities. China has quickly become one of the main cooperation partners in São Tomé, with promises of investment and support in areas such as education, technical training, agriculture and infrastructure. The researcher recalled that even before formal relations, Beijing never completely broke with Sao Tome, keeping the country involved in the activities of the Macao Forum, albeit only as an observer, a strategy he considers "typical of Chinese diplomacy." "China does not fully close the doors. It can suspend relationships, but if it is something of national interest, it is usually renegotiated again," he said. “Limited Results” Nevertheless, Cátia Miriam Costa acknowledged that the concrete results of cooperation are still limited. “There are more projects in the role than properly ongoing works,” he said, attributing part of the responsibility to the weak institutional capacity of São Tomé, which only recently began to create structures to attract and negotiate foreign investment. Among the sectors with potential for the deepening of cooperation, the researcher highlighted the fishing, marine resources and eventually cocoa. Oil exploration raises “high risks”, both for technical complexity and environmental limitations. "China is interested in the region, but it is not because Sao Tome is an attractive market -because it is not -, yes, for its location, stability and integration capacity in a broader regional project," he said. The researcher also stressed Chinese investment in Chinese language teaching in Sao Tome, which also aims to "create a network of people with language dominance, familiar with culture and potentially useful for the future of bilateral relations." "China maintains a strategic interest in the relationship, even if it does not express it with great visibility. And for a country like Sao Tome, any small help can have a significant impact," he concluded. Reports of four Sao Tomers who followed courses in China Denise, Lucineidy, Reginaldo, and Aithysa grew up under the sign of an alliance with Taiwan, until life and academic path were redefined by the rupture of diplomatic ties between Sao Tome and Taipei in 2016. Denise Aragão Fortes still remembers her hand to Tsai Ing-Wen. It was November 2016, the day of Africa in Taiwan was celebrated, and the official was attended at the time. It is very likely that behind the scenes would already outline the end of diplomacy between Taiwan and Sao Tome and Principe, but for this student of International Relations at the University of Ming Chuan, Taoyuan, North Taiwanese, the news, who arrived a month after these celebrations, on December 21, was a surprise. “There was no rumors, nothing,” recalls Lusa Denise, now 29, working in marketing and living in Almada, Portugal. When the secondary finished, also the bonds between the island and the African nation, agreed in 1997, had just reached the age of adult. There was “very closeness” between the parts, with Taiwanese friendships in the family. Normality shaken this December 2016. Studying with a scholarship granted by Taipé, Denise and other St.-Tome students in Taiwan was given the option of continuing studies without financial assistance, or being transferred to China as scholarships. Being at the end of the academic course, Denise remained in Taoyuan. Most, however, changed geography, university and life. Country “full of opportunities” Lucineidy Almeida, now 28, saw the arrival in Tianjin, northern China, as "a new restart" in a "country full of opportunities." Attending the second year of biotechnology in Taichung, this native of Santo António had some difficulty in following the degree in Mandarin. A limitation that would eventually surpass, evaluates today, but in China, had the possibility of studying in English pharmaceutical sciences. He says he learned of the diplomatic break through social networks and, like all students who spoke to Lusa, left criticism of conducting the process, with “many uncertainties”, information given “on time”, “a feeling of disrespect”, and, in the middle, the suspension of the bags. Two months after the announcement, he landed in Hong Kong, where he treated his visa, although he still unaware of what his final destination. Only upon arrival in Beijing was he told that he went to Tianjin, recalls Lucineidy, living today in Portugal, in Cacém, and working as an English and Portuguese interpreter in the medical field. Regarding the diplomatic interruption, it notes that "from what was realized at the time", it was "a monetary question": "in the sense that China offered more [to Sao Tomé] than Taiwan at the time could provide." The São Tome Prime Minister of the time, Patrice Trovoada, considered the unilateral break of relations as “the right”, taking into account the authorities' view of the country's development. "We decided the principle of joining one China and when adhering implies the cut of relations with Taiwan. The international scenario 20 years ago, not the same as today," he added. But the new political order did not take students to advance in the academic career. Aithysa Ramos, 32, is still in Beijing, where, after leaving Taiwan, she concluded the master's degree in business management. If this morning of 2016, the story had not taken this course, would probably have been in Taiwan, where he had lived seven years ago. At the time, it now remembers the English education teacher, was “devastated and angry”: “It was like my second home, I passed [part of] my adolescence, growth phases”. Reginaldo was in the second year of Business Management at the University of Yuan Ze, Taoyuan, when he stayed to the news. He realized that he “had no power” to change the course of history. The initial shock, assumes today, was really the cold. Despite admitting "it was" always a process of doubt, "China, where he moved two months after the cutting cut," it was a surprise for the better. " “Because I was still here, not coming back, I can say yes, it was the best thing that happened,” he says.

item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping yesterday congratulated Jennifer Geerlings-Simons for his election as president of Suriname, who considered as a “strategic cooperation partner in China in the Caribbean region”. In his congratulations message, quoted by the Chinese Official Agency Xinhua, Xi Jinping pointed out that the two countries have lived “solid and constant growth, with practical and fruitful cooperation in various areas and a close coordination in multilateral matters” since the establishment of diplomatic relations for 49 years. The Chinese head of state stressed the “great importance” that it attributed to the development of bilateral relations between China and Suriname and, according to EFE, was available to work with Geerlings-Simons. Work with the elected president of Suriname intends to “deepen friendly and mutually beneficial cooperation, as well as boost the bilateral strategic partnership of cooperation,” he said. Jennifer Geerlings-Simons was elected president of Suriname last weekend, becoming, at age 71, in the first woman to lead this South American country, in a suffrage where she was the only candidate for office. Geerlings-Simons was elected by Parliament, after the National Democratic Party (PND), to which it belongs, allied to five small parties to get the two thirds of votes necessary to access the presidency of Suriname. Geerlings-Simons's investiture for a five-year term in front of the country with about 600,000 inhabitants is scheduled for July 16. The Suriname, a former Dutch colony, beaten by rebellions and state blows since it became independent in 1975, has important recently discovered oil reserves.

Brushes Museum Diving into Huzhou's past, entering one of the city's most picturesque streets. A Christian church dominates the street and around, stores occupy the part under the two -story houses. Continuing, curiosity leads us to meet the stone bridge with three arches built in 1539, with some embedded ornamental stones. Hence and to southwest, we go to the garden of the painter and calciple Zhao Mengfu (1254-1322) Painter Museum. This was native of Wuxing (today Huzhou), named after courtesy and pseudonyms Songxue, Oubo and Shuijinggong Daoren. He was a descendant prince of the Song Dynasty, but he served the Mongols Yuan Dynasty as an official at the Hanlin Academy. As a painter, he specializes in the representation of horses and used recreating themes and styles of the old masters, with simple colors to make the landscapes. In addition to being a master of Tang Dynasty techniques, he was an excellent Caligraph, considered one of the main four in the history of Chinese calligraphy. Already in the garden, the serenity with which the green of the vegetation is combined in the lake with the brown of the rest pavilions, or in the woods of the tea houses, makes us there a long time, recreating figures with the reflection in the waters of the ornamental stones. We have to leave the garden to visit the Brushes Museum which, despite being encompassed in the same room, has an autonomous entrance. Huzhou brushes are referenced as the best in the country and so you have to see how they are made. In chronological terms, the brush was invented in the late 3rd century A.N.E. By Meng Tian, a military commander of the Qin Dynasty. However, it is perceived by the painted vessels of different neolithic cultures, which must have existed for at least five thousand years. Therefore, Meng Tian will be linked, not to the invention, but to the improvement of brushes. Also the city of Huzhou is not the real place of production of the best brushes, but has won this title since in ancient times Shanlian, in the municipality of Wuxing, province of Zhejiang, was over his jurisdiction. The handwriting brushes made had their heyday during the Yuan Dynasty and are still considered among the best in all of China. Four steps are required to manufacture the HU brush, and the coat of the rabbit, the fingernail and the goat hair is used. After the fat is removed with tire juice, the hair is cut into equal sizes and enter a solution to clean them. They are then united at the base with arabic gum and after drying, united with a tile that unites them to the bamboo. With the brush made in its structure, the other phase of the process is passed. The hair is bumped to a porridge made of algae to put them together and with the wire wrapped a tip is created, the most important part of the brush. This wire that goes through the hair, on a lap gives the cone shape and also serves to remove the excess of the agglutinator papa. With extreme patience and skill, the brushes are clean, rounded, creating a tip, with good elasticity. Then the brush, ready, passes to the hands of another employee, where in the bamboo cable are recorded the characters Tian Kuan Trade Mark, which replaced the old “double goat” brand. The goat hair (HAO) brushes (HAO) are soft and serve to write small characters, rabbit hair are hard and those of the fingernail are between the two, with great elasticity for the handwriting of large characters. Sometimes a mixture of different hair is made, using those of other animals. There are brushes of all kinds of sizes, serving some to paint and others to call. The best for Chinese handwriting are the rabbit and goat hair mix. HU brushes were widely used in the imperial court. In the other part of the museum is the painter's room Zhao Mengfu with its utensils and some works, where the recorded stones are not lacking. Although the museum has a sales section, after leaving the museum and already on the street, a set of stores is dedicated to the sale of products for Chinese painting. Long before the authorities were part of the 85 square kilometers of maritime areas, there was the idea of lifting a stilts museum to consecrate this type of existing housing in Coloane. However, years later, the direction of tourism services says that the project will not even move forward, having been suspended in 2016
Between 2016 and 2017, the government planned to raise a museum about Coloane's stalps to tell the story of these peculiar houses of Macao. However, after news was published in the press to convey the inauguration of the project in 2017, the Directorate of Tourism Services (STD) confirmed to HM that no museum will be born. More: not only will it not be built, but the plan was aborted nine years ago. “Due to the inclusion of the area where stilts are located in the government's urban planning plan for the coloane riverside, Lai Chi Vun shipyards and Navegantes Street, STD ended the 'Museum of the Museum of the Museum of the House' in 2016, and, subsequently, completed the 'Museum of House Project' procedure. Canceled ”, was referred to in the answer. The cancellation in 2016 is still surprising, given that on June 14 of the same year the Jornal Tribuna de Macao (JTM) reported that the inauguration of the museum would take place in 2017. In this article, statements were cited by the director of STD, Helena de Senna Fernandes, made to the newspaper or Mun, explaining that the “project was in the [conception] phase of design”. They would have been held, including “several consultations to collect opinions from the residents of that area, expecting to improve the proposal of construction”. According to JTM, the project should “be completed by the end of the year” in 2016, so that the work will be “started early 2017”, and STD expected “that the construction was completed in the same year”. After the promise, in 2018 there was still “legal fundamentals” to build the Museum in Coloane, as also reported the JTM. The justification given by the STD was that Macau has not yet had the 85 square kilometers of maritime areas under his jurisdiction, something that has been legislated, precisely, since 2018. A matter of priorities HM sought to know the state of the designer of the Museum of Palafites following the recent launch of a book on the collage of Colaane, by Filipe Afonso, coordinator of the degree in Architecture of the University of São José. Now confronted with the official cancellation of the museum project, the official lamented the decision of the authorities. "The cancellation of the Museum of Slacinas project is not just news about a project that has not advanced, but a starting point to equate Macao's development priorities, the way the heritage is managed and what means for collective memory, in this case of Coloane," he said. In the opinion of the author of “The Colaane Grammar”, “The Plan for the Marginal of Rua dos Navegantes should include proposals for new buildings that use and reinterpret Madeira as the main and essential element of construction”, and the connection of this street with the Lai Chi Vun shipyards, “especially with regard to the sea front, is a unique opportunity to create a coastal corridor that celebrates Colona's seafront history”. Thus, and “given the richness of context and cancellation of the stilts museum, the focus should be on integrating the memory of these structures into the new plane”, so the existing structures of the shipyards, stilts should be restored, maintaining their original and material characteristics, but adapting them to new uses ”. Still on the patrimonial value, Filipe Afonso described, in the interview with HM, the proposal to “classify stilts as heritage to give them legal protection”. "By cataloging existing stilts, the book contributes to preserving the memory of this type of architecture and a broader discussion about its possible protection," he argued, adding that dwellings, many of them left to abandon, "could be reused for experience tourism, or cultural interpretation centers, valuing local history." They could also “be transformed into creative and artistic spaces or in fact propose new wood buildings along the water line, with various uses and that can generate value to the Coloane community, contributing to Macao's cultural and economic diversification”. Hopes Filipe Afonso highlights the process of revitalization and recovery of the Lai Chi Vun shipyard zone as a “initiative with immense historical and cultural value, which refers to the rich tradition of the region's shipbuilding”. In fact, the Lai Chi Vun shipyard zone is one of the “six zones” to recover by the government and operators, which also include places such as the pier in the interior port or Avenida Almeida Ribeiro, among others. In the area of Lai Chi Vun there is already a leisure zone where cultural initiatives have been carried out, with a museum area that tells the history of the Junos construction industry in the territory. In this sense, Filipe Afonso asks that “the Macao government does not limit the design of these projects to a restricted range of‘ short-listed companions ””, ie a restricted group of companies. Also, in his opinion, "Macau has a new generation of talented architects and creative ready to make his contribution." "I believe that through more open ideas contests, these professionals could offer innovative perspectives for the city's urban and cultural challenges. Deleting them from such crucial processes for Macao's urban and cultural development is a waste," he added. The HM contacted other architects to get reactions to the cancellation of the museum project, but did not get answers. What the law says Between the suspension of the project and today a lot has changed. In 2018, Macao arranged from the maritime management bases law, which includes 85 square kilometers of area, and whose principles provides for the environmental preservation of spaces such as those that stilts are inserted. The legislation introduced concepts such as “functional maritime zoning”, in the sense of delimiting zones “with fundamental and specific maritime functions according to location, natural resources, environmental conditions and exploration and use needs”. In the list of principles to be complied with, the legislation speaks of something like “protection of the environment of maritime areas”, in order to “protect natural resources and the environment of the sea, realizing the planning of protection and promotion of the marine ecosystem, and the marine protection should be taken into account”. It should also be “conserving the sustainability of use and development” of these areas, and their use should be done “scientifically”, according to functional maritime zoning ”. In addition to the concrete legislation that tied the paddle museum in 2016, there was also a direct planning plan to MSAR, something that was implemented in 2022 and also brings new directives for the exploration of maritime zones. Coloane now has its own UOPG-Operative Planning and Management Unit, where a “rational organization of public infrastructures and collective use equipment” should apply, as well as “appropriate use of soils” in order to create a “coordinated space structure”. Coloane's UOPG is part of the “ecological conservation zone”, which aims to “protect areas with ecological value” and “contribute to the greater protection of natural resources with ecological value”. Here it will not be allowed “to allocate soils for housing, commercial, industrial, tourist and amusement uses”, reads in the director of the masket. Coloane's UOPG is also integrated into the “green or open public spaces”, and here should be “maintaining the current use for green spaces and outdoor activities, integrating it [Coloane's UOPG] into the green zone or open public spaces”. Specifically, Coloane's UOPG should “promote the development of ecotourism and cultural tourism, with the creation of a tours of nature and the 'green and resilient waist', based on the combination of natural resources, namely hills, sea and coastal lines”. It should also “conserve and optimize existing industrial zones, build the 'waist of knowledge - industry - science' and the 'waist of cooperation of a river, two margins' and, simultaneously, rationally plan the housing zones in adequate location, according to the principle of balance between professional and residential functions”, and these points interconnect with the paradise zone, Navigantes Street and Savings Lai chi vun. The Director Plan also explains that "the predominant use of soils at UOPG Coloane is an ecological conservation zone."

item.title: AL | New Regiment prohibits deputies from disseminating content of the commissions
item.description:
With the new Hemiciclo regiment approved yesterday, the deputies are prohibited from publicizing the subjects discussed at the meetings of the permanent committees, except their presidents and secretaries. The subject generated debate yesterday in the Assembly regarding the limits of what may or may not be said. Pereira Coutinho voted against this article
The deputies of the Legislative Assembly (AL) are now prohibited from disseminating what is discussed at the Hemiciclo Commission meetings, "anyway," with the exception of its president and secretary. These usually disclose the content of the meetings at a press conference after their holding, and this will keep up. This new regulation arises after the vote and discussion, generally and specialty, the alteration to the Rules of Al. It was one of the most discussed topics in yesterday's debate, with the deputies arguing on what can or can not be said, having José Pereira Coutinho voted against this concrete article. The disclosure of information from the meetings, which serves to analyze in the specialty proposals of law and always steering at the closed door, was something that was not yet regulated. Coutinho began by asking if he could disclose the information "during the plenary meeting", for example, having said that "he never heard of any deputy who had violated that duty." "There have been meetings in the past where the secretaries warned about the information that should not be disclosed and nothing has been said. We are only 33 deputies and we should think of the possibility of revealing what was discussed, because it is difficult to define borders about what can or can not be revealed and this will give rise to many discussions later," he said. The legislator also pointed out that "it can be difficult to execute this norm" and that "the principle of transparency" should be followed. Ho Ion Sang, who presided over to the commission that analyzed the new Al Regiment, explained that "the content of the meetings is subject to the duty of confidentiality and this matter was clarified." "The content can be said by the president of the commissions after the meetings, at the press conferences, and journalists can ask questions. In practice remains as always happened and that has given good results," he said. Meet the meetings Another point addressed, whether or not the permanent commissions were held at the closed door, and Pereira Coutinho defended the opening to the public like what happens in Hong Kong. The AL regiment does not prohibit open meetings, but this always depends on a prior deliberation. But iau Teng Pio, deputy, advised against the opening of the meetings. "The purpose of the closed -door meetings is so that members of the government, advisors and deputies can argue at ease even if there is no final decision. Kou Hoi In, president of AL, recalled that “the spirit of the norm has not been changed” and that everything will stay in it, only the ban on what deputies cannot refer outside the commissions. "The reserved character of permanent committees is so that everyone can speak freely and if any deputy says this or that can spoil sensations of injustice in society to deputies and this cannot happen. We have to protect deputies and ensure confidentiality." At yesterday's meeting, there was also the discussion of the duty of the deputy to participate in all permanent committees, even in those to which he does not belong. Several deputies spoke of the need for better coordination of meetings agendas. "In the future there may be more practical coordination because there are many meetings and proposals of law. We can schedule the meetings so that there are more deputies," he said. Moreover, the new Al regiment prohibits deputies by "clothing or signs, banners, signs or other objects that have offensive content or political provocation, or undermine the dignity of the AL".

item.title: About 97 percent of Spanish adolescents victim of sexual aggression on the internet
item.description: About 97 percent of teenagers in Spain is the victim of some kind of sexual violence on the internet, warned yesterday the Save the Children Non-Governmental Organization (NGO). The NGO released a report yesterday with the title “Networks that hold. Sexual exploitation of childhood and adolescence in digital environments”, which elaborated with the European Association for Digital Transition and which includes official data and an inquiry to over 1,000 young people aged 18 to 21. According to the study, 97 percent of these young people said they were victims of some kind of sexual violence on the Internet during adolescence, including contacts from adults for sexual purposes, unauthorized diffusion of intimate images or blackmail and threats to send intimate and sexual content. Another type of violence enhanced in the report is the use of artificial intelligence tools to create sexual content from a real image of adolescents or children (content known as 'Deepfake' or 'Ultra counterfeits'). According to the study, one in five young Spaniards was the victim of the creation and diffusion of these 'Deepfake' during adolescence, namely with sharing by another person, to third parties, and without consent, of their own nudity images, elaborated through artificial intelligence. "The internet, social networks and technologies not only facilitate capture and exposure to sexual exploitation -related risks, but can be the means by which these violence against boys and girls are committed and allow their perpetuation," said Save the Children, in a statement released from the study published yesterday. Starter Social networks are the most frequent way for aggressors to start contacts with the teenage victims, with the study also highlighting online video games in the case of boys. After this first contact, they move to applications and messages of messages such as WhatsApp, Telegram or Discord. Girls are the ones that most denounce to be pressured to send intimate content (28.5 percent from 18.4 percent of boys), with the study revealing that all victims had shared personal or intimate information on the internet during childhood and adolescence. According to the study, only 50 percent of young people when they were smaller considered contact with unknown people one of the main risks of the internet and only 32.9 percent mentioned as dangerous the consented send of intimate images to adults. On the other hand, 70 percent states that it has not seen as a risk, in adolescence, the manipulation of photographs and videos with artificial intelligence. Asked the reasons why they sent intimate or sexual images of themselves, 48 percent says it did not know it was something potentially dangerous, 46 percent weighed that it was normal and 42 percent sought attention, affection or some kind of validation. Alone at home In this context, Save the Children warns, in the study, for the lack of follow -up of minors; The scarce digital formation, in cybersecurity, privacy and recognition of danger situations and the intensive use of technologies by children and adolescents. According to data from the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Spain, cited in the NGO report, in 2023 there were 4,896 complaints for offenses on the Internet against children and adolescents, 1,068 of which were sexual crimes. "These numbers represent only the tip of the iceberg, as most cases do not know, in part, for the absence of denunciation and, in part, for the difficulties in detection, which increases when these facts take place in an online environment," said Save the Children Catalina Perazzo, quoted in the NGO statement.

item.title: Sao Tome and Prince | Relationship with China is discreet, but strategic
item.description:
On Saturday, 50 years of the independence of Sao Tome and Principe were celebrated. The future advances to the rhythm of diplomatic relations with other Portuguese speaking countries. For academic Cátia Miriam Costa, the African country and China are strategic partners, despite the description of the relationship between both
Researcher Cátia Miriam Costa considers that the relationship between Sao Tome and Principe and China remains discreet, despite being almost celebrating a decade, with growing Beijing's strategic interest in the position of the archipelago in the South Atlantic. "Since neither country nor another talks much about the subject, we end up not realizing the depth of the relationship well. But I believe it is not yet a very deep relationship," the researcher at the Center for International Studies of ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, noted to the Lusa. The geostrategic position of the archipelago, located in the Gulf of Guinea,, however, feeds Beijing's interest, namely in the context of the Chinese bet on the expansion of logistics and sea corridors in the South Atlantic. "Sao Tome, if it is not a very important port in logistical terms, is a relevant port for control, for example, of piracy, threats. Therefore, this position also certainly reflected by Beijing," he explained. The restoration of formal ties in 2016, after two decades of Taiwan's recognition by Sao Tome, was a “pragmatic” decision of the African country, and a trump card for Beijing Diplomacy, which always maintained “open channels”, even during the period of removal, Cátia Miriam Costa explained. "The relationship with China is more fruitful because it brings other counterparts," explained the researcher. "It was also for these counterparts that [in 1997] Sao Tome exchanged the Popular Republic of China for Taiwan, because at that time the Popular Republic of China was a developing country. So it didn't have to offer what Taiwan had, which was perfectly integrated into the international market," he said. A VOLTE-FACE In December 2016, Sao Tome officially announced the establishment of relations with the Popular Republic of China, ending the recognition of Taiwan. The decision caused the immediate cancellation of the scholarships offered by Taiwan to St.-Tome students, many of whom were eventually integrated into the other Chinese universities. China has quickly become one of the main cooperation partners in São Tomé, with promises of investment and support in areas such as education, technical training, agriculture and infrastructure. The researcher recalled that even before formal relations, Beijing never completely broke with Sao Tome, keeping the country involved in the activities of the Macao Forum, albeit only as an observer, a strategy he considers "typical of Chinese diplomacy." "China does not fully close the doors. It can suspend relationships, but if it is something of national interest, it is usually renegotiated again," he said. “Limited Results” Nevertheless, Cátia Miriam Costa acknowledged that the concrete results of cooperation are still limited. “There are more projects in the role than properly ongoing works,” he said, attributing part of the responsibility to the weak institutional capacity of São Tomé, which only recently began to create structures to attract and negotiate foreign investment. Among the sectors with potential for the deepening of cooperation, the researcher highlighted the fishing, marine resources and eventually cocoa. Oil exploration raises “high risks”, both for technical complexity and environmental limitations. "China is interested in the region, but it is not because Sao Tome is an attractive market -because it is not -, yes, for its location, stability and integration capacity in a broader regional project," he said. The researcher also stressed Chinese investment in Chinese language teaching in Sao Tome, which also aims to "create a network of people with language dominance, familiar with culture and potentially useful for the future of bilateral relations." "China maintains a strategic interest in the relationship, even if it does not express it with great visibility. And for a country like Sao Tome, any small help can have a significant impact," he concluded. Reports of four Sao Tomers who followed courses in China Denise, Lucineidy, Reginaldo, and Aithysa grew up under the sign of an alliance with Taiwan, until life and academic path were redefined by the rupture of diplomatic ties between Sao Tome and Taipei in 2016. Denise Aragão Fortes still remembers her hand to Tsai Ing-Wen. It was November 2016, the day of Africa in Taiwan was celebrated, and the official was attended at the time. It is very likely that behind the scenes would already outline the end of diplomacy between Taiwan and Sao Tome and Principe, but for this student of International Relations at the University of Ming Chuan, Taoyuan, North Taiwanese, the news, who arrived a month after these celebrations, on December 21, was a surprise. “There was no rumors, nothing,” recalls Lusa Denise, now 29, working in marketing and living in Almada, Portugal. When the secondary finished, also the bonds between the island and the African nation, agreed in 1997, had just reached the age of adult. There was “very closeness” between the parts, with Taiwanese friendships in the family. Normality shaken this December 2016. Studying with a scholarship granted by Taipé, Denise and other St.-Tome students in Taiwan was given the option of continuing studies without financial assistance, or being transferred to China as scholarships. Being at the end of the academic course, Denise remained in Taoyuan. Most, however, changed geography, university and life. Country “full of opportunities” Lucineidy Almeida, now 28, saw the arrival in Tianjin, northern China, as "a new restart" in a "country full of opportunities." Attending the second year of biotechnology in Taichung, this native of Santo António had some difficulty in following the degree in Mandarin. A limitation that would eventually surpass, evaluates today, but in China, had the possibility of studying in English pharmaceutical sciences. He says he learned of the diplomatic break through social networks and, like all students who spoke to Lusa, left criticism of conducting the process, with “many uncertainties”, information given “on time”, “a feeling of disrespect”, and, in the middle, the suspension of the bags. Two months after the announcement, he landed in Hong Kong, where he treated his visa, although he still unaware of what his final destination. Only upon arrival in Beijing was he told that he went to Tianjin, recalls Lucineidy, living today in Portugal, in Cacém, and working as an English and Portuguese interpreter in the medical field. Regarding the diplomatic interruption, it notes that "from what was realized at the time", it was "a monetary question": "in the sense that China offered more [to Sao Tomé] than Taiwan at the time could provide." The São Tome Prime Minister of the time, Patrice Trovoada, considered the unilateral break of relations as “the right”, taking into account the authorities' view of the country's development. "We decided the principle of joining one China and when adhering implies the cut of relations with Taiwan. The international scenario 20 years ago, not the same as today," he added. But the new political order did not take students to advance in the academic career. Aithysa Ramos, 32, is still in Beijing, where, after leaving Taiwan, she concluded the master's degree in business management. If this morning of 2016, the story had not taken this course, would probably have been in Taiwan, where he had lived seven years ago. At the time, it now remembers the English education teacher, was “devastated and angry”: “It was like my second home, I passed [part of] my adolescence, growth phases”. Reginaldo was in the second year of Business Management at the University of Yuan Ze, Taoyuan, when he stayed to the news. He realized that he “had no power” to change the course of history. The initial shock, assumes today, was really the cold. Despite admitting "it was" always a process of doubt, "China, where he moved two months after the cutting cut," it was a surprise for the better. " “Because I was still here, not coming back, I can say yes, it was the best thing that happened,” he says.

The revitalization of the 23-25 quay in the interior port area and the eternal happiness courtyard should be completed later this year, being interconnected with the projects designed and funded between the executive and the six game operators for six ancient Macao zones. The warranty was given yesterday by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP. item.title: BRICS | Seventh Cimeira ends today with focus on Trump's fares
item.description:
Since Saturday, leaders of the countries that are part of the BRICS Group have been gathered in Rio de Janeiro for another summit designed to think about the reform of institutions and inclusion of more emerging economies, as well as the fight against Trump's rates. Highlight for the absences of Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin
Since Saturday, Rio de Janeiro hosts the BRICS Group leaders, which ends today. The first day was based on the dialogue around the ambition of emerging economies to reform international institutions and the defense of multilateralism. "I think the main message is this: at the time of so many international crises, conflicts, we are experiencing a succession of conflicts that only increase from year to year, having a set of countries reaffirming the power of diplomacy, cooperation, the need to act jointly, to solve the problems of the population and not to generate more destruction, such as conflicts, it is an opportunity that we always have to take advantage of," Lyrio, guide of discussions and agreements of heads of state at the conference, designated by the Brazilian presidency of the BRICS. In all, about 30 countries and nine international organizations have been present, with the Brazilian head of state, Lula da Silva leading the meeting, which has Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa, Angola President and African Union, the Secretary-General of United Nations, António Guterres, among others. The main absences are Russian and Chinese heads of state, two BRICS founding countries. Vladimir Putin, the target of a warrant of detention issued by the International Criminal Court (ICC), on suspicion of illegal deportation of Ukrainian children to Russia, will only participate in video conferencing. Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will be the representatives of the two founding countries of the group, which represents more than 40 percent of the global population and more than 35 percent of the world's Gross Domestic Product (GDP). From China with Love According to Chinese state agency Xinhua, Chinese prime minister promised to “expand cooperation with Brazil” in the areas of “digital and aerospace economy”. Li Qiang spoke on Saturday, as part of a meeting with Lula da Silva, noting that the country intends to “work with Brazil to take advantage of each other and expand cooperation in areas such as digital economy, green economy, scientific and technological and aerospace innovation”. Xinhua quotes words from Li Qiang, who referred to the fact that “China is ready to work with Brazil to continue efforts to enrich the dimensions of bilateral relations and achieve more concrete results in cooperation in order to provide more benefits to both peoples”. One of the points out of this meeting was the realization, in 2026, of the year of China-Brazil culture, which provides for an intensification in cooperation in areas such as “education, youth and health”, in order to facilitate “more exchanges between peoples and strengthen public support for China-Brazil's friendship and cooperation”. “China is willing to work with Brazil to further consolidate and deepen bilateral cooperation in trade, finance and infrastructure development within the high quality cooperation of Belt And Road [track and route]”, the Chinese prime minister, who did not forget the great flag of this BRICS Summit: multilateralism. Thus, I read Qiang considered “the two countries as fierce defenders of multilateralism and free trade”, saying that “China is willing to improve communication and coordination with Brazil in multilateral structures such as the United Nations, BRICS and G20, work in union with developing countries to promote an equal and ordered multipolar world and universally beneficial and inclusive economic globalization, and provide more certainty and stability to the world. ” On the other hand, Lula da Silva said that "Brazil is willing to deepen communication and multilateral coordination with China, to oppose unilateralism and defend multilateralism and free trade in order to promote peace and world development." After the meeting between the two leaders, “cooperation documents in areas such as tax and financial matters, artificial intelligence, alignment of development strategies and aerospace” were signed.
Cuba's debut Cuba President Miguel Díaz-Canel also participates in the 17th BRICS Summit, being the first time Cuba has associated with this geopolitical and economic cooperation group. Under the motto “reinforcing cooperation in the global south for more inclusive and sustainable governance”, the BRICS Summit's agenda comprises two central axes: the consolidation of cooperation between the global southern countries and the promotion of reforms in international governance mechanisms. Created in 2009 throughout Brazil, Russia, India and China, BRICS admitted South Africa two years later and, since last year, integrates six new effective members: Egypt, United Arab Emirates, Ethiopia, Iran, Indonesia and Saudi Arabia. Brazil invited to this summit leaders from various Latin American countries, including Mexico, Colombia, Uruguay and Chile. The status of associate, which takes Cuba to Rio de Janeiro, was approved in October 2024 during the summit of the group held in the Russian city of Kazan, which was made official in 2025, recalled the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Caribbean country. In addition to geopolitical issues, BRICS have sought in Rio de Janeiro in the organization's economic weight, namely in the financial domain, in which they have been looking for a dollar for years for trade in the group. The host president, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, president of Brazil, stressed last Friday the importance of a mechanism with these characteristics, recognizing, however, that the current international political context is "complicated". What is on the agenda On the first day, the heads of state and government of the BRICS participated in two plenary sessions, particularly on "peace and safety and reform of global governance" and the second relative to the strengthening of multilateralism, economic and financial affairs and artificial intelligence. " In the latter, the revision of the enthusiastic participation in the World Bank, the realignment of IMF shares [International Monetary Fund] and the increase in the representation of developing countries in leadership positions in international financial institutions and the importance of reforming the UN Security Council. In addition, as it has been happening during the BRICS ministerial meetings over the past few months, an increase in unilateral unilateral unilateral protectionist measures should be made in reference to the measures announced by the President of the United States, Donald Trump; as well as an appeal to reinforce the use of local currencies in trade between the bloc countries. Today the plenary session will be on “Environment, COP30 and Global Health”. The term BRIC was created by a Goldman Sachs analyst to refer to emerging economies who began to stand out worldwide beyond the US, and the BRICS first gathered at the level of heads in 2009. This is the first meeting that brings together the new group configuration with 11 member countries. Brazil has mobilized about 20,000 military personnel, as well as fighters with missiles, anti-drug systems and elite shooters to ensure the safety of the event. The safety operation, called Operational Command Redeemer Set, also provides for the use of 300 vehicles, 38 armored vehicles, 18 boats and eight helicopters.

item.title: Cape Verde | Évora family, between Macau and the rest of the world
item.description:
Tomorrow are 50 years of Cape Verde's independence, the country from which the first levada of the Évora family came out in the 1940s, towards Macao, where he won roots. Nowadays, only one member of the family remains in the territory, the cardiologist Mário Évora
There were once a dozen Évoras in Macao, where they arrived in the 1940s, but only Mario Évora resists, with the family repeating the migrations that mark both Cape Verde and the Macanese. "We have been between eight and ten Évoras in Macau," Sports Medicine expert Humberto Évora told Lusa from Lisbon, where he has lived since he renovated. The maternal grandparents of Humberto (the last of the family to be born in Cape Verde) and Mário (the first to be born in Macau) arrived in the east in the late 1940s, with five of the couple's six children. A year later, the daughter who had stayed with her husband in Cape Verde came to Macau, already with baby Humberto. The initial plan was for two years, but the couple ended up three decades and have three more children: Mario, Rui and Maria Helena. In 1971, it was the turn of Humberto and Mário to leave to study medicine in Lisbon, but not without a great fright linked to the colonial war that had lasted a decade ago. "As we went to the university we could postpone military inspection, but the papers did not come from Macao and we risk being considered refractory," said Humberto. The situation resolved, but Mario admitted to Lusa the fear of the mobilization. "We had this persecution, we had to go through the year not to go with the sides in the war," he explained. “The Shock” in Lisbon Upon arrival in Lisbon, “we were soon welcomed and integrated into the Cape Verdean student community,” said Humberto, at a time of student agitation and politics. "There were periods when it was almost daily, manifestations of students against the regime, the shock police enter the canteen inside and give some suckling," said Mario. Humberto admitted that "it was a shock, for those who came from Macau, where there was little political culture and the colonial war was seen as a struggle against terrorists." In a summer, the young man, who was integrated into a Cape Verdean group of intervention music, left with a friend "to the overseas ride out of guitar on his back." “I always remember the first time in France, that I saw the colonial war described on the contrary on television, the struggle for the liberation of a colonial power of occupation,” said Humberto. Independence When the two brothers finished the medical course, the independence of Cape Verde, on July 5, 1975, led them to the root return. "There was a movement of many of our colleagues to contribute to a new country, which was beginning to take the first steps," said Mario, then a formed cardiologist. Also because, recalled Humberto, some of the friends of Lisbon had, however, became members of the Government of Cape Verde. "There was this possibility, but the return to Macao, a place where it had spent so long, was natural," he explained. “I was born in Cape Verde, I spent part of my life in Portugal, I grew up in Macao, I am also Macaense. I am a citizen of the world,” said Humberto. Macanese are a Euro-Asian community, most of which Lusodescendants, with roots in Macau, although many have emigrated, due to the economic situation or fear created by the transition from Portugal Administration to China in 1999. From the Évora brothers, Rui, engineer, left before the transition to Cape Verde, where he even worked on the project of the Macao Hotel David Chow built on the beach, but was inaugurated. The younger sister, Maria Helena, a documentary science expert who has even worked in the Macao Historical Archive, is currently in the City Council of Oeiras. The children “are all out” between the United Kingdom, Cape Verde and Portugal, said Mario. "Now the world is smaller and it is going where there are opportunities," he said. Humberto also faces migrations "as a natural process, not only for Cape Verdeans, but even to the Macanese." Nothing that has prevented the two brothers from keeping their ties with the archipelago. Humberto divides the time between Portugal and Cape Verde, and has been the official doctor of Cape Verdean sports for decades to the main international competitions. Mario was one of the founders-and president for ten years-of the Macau-Cabo Green Friendship Association. "We had here Ildo Lobo, Tito Paris, and my cousin," said the cardiologist, before taking a break and adds, with a smile: "Cesaria Évora."

item.title: DSAMA | GUARANTEED QUALITY OF WATER SUPPLY
item.description: The Directorate of Maritime and Water Affairs Services (DSAMA) ensures that "the quality of water provided in Macao fulfills the standards." The position was taken in response to the Macau Daily Times newspaper, as a result of doubts about the water quality of the Jiangmen public network. In recent days there have been several complaints inside due to the fact that the water of the tap supplied in Jiangmen comes with a yellow or brownish color. The issue was explained by local authorities with the adoption of new procedures in water disinfection and treatment. The explanations did not prevent several images from circulating online and in the official media. In Macao, indicates the Macau Daily Times, 90 percent of water comes from the Xijiang Modaomen waterway, located in Zhuhai. However, strange waterway extends to a section of Rio Ri, which passes through Jiangmen. Regarding these aspects, DSAMA has ensured that together with the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) controls the quality of the supplied water and that there is a joint safety mechanism with the interior, for emergency cases on water quality. This warning mechanism, the authorities explained, works by classification of emergencies to varying degrees, which require different answers.

item.title: Water | Ordient Tight supervision after recent scandals
item.description:
The four locally bottled touched water episodes that failed quality and security tests led the deputy to ask for greater control of the products in Macau and to ask for new ways to test the waters
Deputy Song Pek Kei appeals to the authorities to reinforce the water quality control measures in the territory. This is how the Legislator linked to the Fujian community reacted to recent locally bottled waters who do not comply with quality or safety standards. At the interpetement, the deputy wrote to expect authorities to contribute to ensure the quality of bottled water in Macao and correct existing inspection failures. And one of the problems identified by the deputy involves the way water quality control is done: “Although the institute for municipal issues regularly make random inspections, most of these inspections are made through analyzes to water samples, so the safety of the production line and water -recycled carboys is not controlled,” wrote Song. Since early May, authorities have revealed at least four cases where different brands of bottled and distributed water in Macao did not meet standards and quality. The targeted brands are the Iceblue water, from the Oi Kou Pou Factory, brand Ieong Iat Tat, from the factory of the same name, the water Sun, from Miram Group, and NK water from the NK drinking water factory. Under these cases, which were detected by AMI, Song Pek Kei acknowledged that measures were taken to deal with the different situations. However, it criticized the lack of a broader quality and safety control mechanism. Repeated cases The deputy linked to the Fujian community was concerned about having been identified "so many cases" in a short time, which contributes to a "social concern" in the face of the supplied water. Song Pek Kei writes that another of the population's concerns aims at the water available in public spaces, in which the carboys often do not identify the water supplier, do not present the results of the latest water quality tests, nor the recommended date of water consumption. In addition, Song wants the government to make available in public spaces the date of the last cleaning of the machines that provide water from the carboys. For this reason, the legislator expects the government to ask the water suppliers to fix labels with information in the water carboys. In addition, the deputy asks the machines to be clean and kept regularly, especially in public spaces and services, such as schools, hospitals and homes for the elderly. One of the waters aimed at quality problems has seen the M-Mark certification, a seal of quality administration, has been suspended. On this aspect, Song Pek Kei considered that this type of certification must always be dependent on quality tests so that products in Macau can develop a stronger reputation.

item.title: Finance | Public accounts with loss before the reinforcement of social support
item.description:
Public accounts presented in June losses of 289.4 million patacas, a record contrary to the trend since the beginning of the year. Between January and June, the MSAR has an surplus of 11.4 billion of patacas
Public accounts show a loss of 289.4 million patacas in June, even before a budget revision to reinforce social support. However, when the period between January and July is considered, data from the Directorate of Finance Services (DSF) show a surplus in public accounts of 11.4 billion. This value represents a 2.5 percent drop compared to the end of May, when Macau had a surplus of 11.7 billion patacas. Still, the surplus of the city between January and June was 40.3 percent higher than in the same period last year and is already higher than the government forecast for the year 2025: 6.83 billion Patacas. Macao closed 2024 with an surplus of 15.8 billion patacas, more than twice the one recorded the previous year. Macao's public expense fell 8.2 percent in the first half of the year, compared to the same period of 2024, to 41.4 billion patacas. The only reason for the fall was spending on social support and subsidies, which decreased 17.7 percent to 20.7 billion patacas. But the Legislative Assembly approved on Wednesday a government proposal to increase by 2.86 billion the expenses provided for in the budget to reinforce social support. The review includes the creation of a subsidy, totaling 54,000 patacas, for children up to 3 years, to raise the lowest birth in the world. Smaller recipes Macao current revenue also fell 0.95 percent in the first half of the year to 52.3 billion patacas. The main reason for the decrease was a drop of 62.3 percent to 520 million patacas, in the “property income”, a heading that includes the revenue of land concessions. On the contrary, the revenues of taxes on the game - which represent 86.4 percent of the total - rose 1 percent to 45.3 billion patacas. The six city game operators pay a 35 percent direct tax on the game's revenues, 2.4 percent for the Social Security Fund and urban and tourist development, and 1.6 percent delivered to the Macao Foundation for cultural, educational, scientific, academics and philanthropic purposes. The total revenues of Macao casinos reached 118.8 billion patacas in the first half of the year, 4.4 percent than in the same period of 2024. On April 15, Sam Hou Fai admitted to fear a budget deficit in 2025, due to the slowdown in game revenues.

item.title: Game | Leona Lee believes dependence will continue
item.description: Academic Leona Lee believes that the government's major projects won't be enough to reverse the economy's dependence on the game. The opinion was shared by the economy teacher to Radio Macau. "What government is trying to do is just increase the size of the cake. We know that the performance of casinos activity is increasing, but there are also the other things. But, if we look at GDP composition [Gross Domestic Product], we also have 4 more years, and in terms of GDP calculation, we should not expect a very obvious or effective change of GDP composition," Lee said. The projects aim to build the International Tourist neighborhood, the extension of the airport, the bet on a research and development center and the enlargement of the University of Macau to Montanha Island. The Académica also argued that it is not recommended that the government wants to intervene in the composition of GDP, because it can undermine other policies, such as attracting qualified frames abroad, due to the need to adjust the sources of management of management to future reality: “The government does not have to impose its own view of the structure of revenues. Because the game has a fixed rate. Thus, if the game's revenues, the tax, the tax, the tax. It will increase proportionally, ”he explained. "But if we think of the other sources of government revenue, these would be taxes on income, taxes on societies. I think that if these taxes increase, it will want to want to attract people to invest in Macao," he added.

item.title: Transport | Ron Lam wants new evaluation of special taxis
item.description: With special taxi licenses awarded in 2017 and 2018 to end in 2028, Deputy Ron Lam wants the government to make a new assessment of whether the adopted model is the best for Macao's population. The subject is approached through a written interpellation of the deputy. Special taxis aims to allow a telephone transport vehicle, or through the taxi center, and also serve people who need special travel care. According to Ron Lam, the government should rethink the model and consider whether there will be more beneficial alternatives to the population. If it should be concluded that the elimination of the special license system is more beneficial, Lam wants the government to point out alternatives. Regarding the complaints of taxi drivers, the deputy points out that drivers complain of the obligation to reach services marked at least 30 minutes in advance, a measure imposed by the concessionaire after the report of the audit commissioner. Before that, the minimum in advance was 10 minutes, which allowed to serve more customers. In addition to these issues, Ron Lam points out that Hong Kong authorities will approve legislation to enable transportation through mobile applications. The deputy wants to know if there is intention in Macao to follow the same path and plans to move with a public consultation.

item.title: FSS | Retroactive social support paid this month
item.description: The Social Security Fund (FSS) will pay this month the retroactive to its beneficiaries related to the increases in the amount of the attributed social support. The retroactive runs until January this year, and “the difference regarding the pension to the elderly and the disability pension” between January and June this year, including the difference regarding the extraordinary performance of January, will be paid together with pensions from July to September to assign in mid -month, FSS explained. Regarding the other subsidies, this month is also paid, with the FSS warning that the amounts of the benefit difference varies from case to case, especially for the calculation of the pension to the elderly, whose value is different depending on the application of the old regime or new regime, the age for the presentation of the application as well as the number of months of contributions actually performed ”.

item.title: Stages | Applications end on the 17th
item.description: Applications to the internship plan to create better work prospects, organized by the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL), end next Thursday, July 17. The objective of the DSAL program includes internship opportunities in Macao and inland and aims to “provide higher education finalists the opportunity for three months of professional experience, helping them raise their work skills in order to reinforce their competitiveness in employment”. The program foresees a total of 850 internship vacancies, of which 808 in Macao and 42 in the interior, in nine branches of activity such as tourism, finance, technology, health, social services, retail, construction, public services and civil aviation. Candidates must hold the resident identity ticket and have obtained a degree, or higher academic degree, after 2023. During this period, interns "may" receive a monthly internship allowance assigned by the company in the amount of 8 thousand patacas, or a value in equivalent renminbis. The application deadline began on June 18, and interested parties can apply through the Macao Single Account, in the area of this program, having to submit the required forms and documents online. Information about the program on the DSAL portal is only available in Chinese.

After avoiding the closure of the application, prolonging its service life for seventy -five days, Trump launched his proposal. Fifty percent of the Chinese social network should end in American hands. Compared to 2020, when the intention actually seemed to ban the "Chinese application", the president changed his position. The merit is also from his granddaughter Kai who, as a skilled golfer and content creator, made Tiktok come 'in the heart', who believes the application was fundamental along with his frequency of podcasts, suggested by the young Barron to win the vows of young people.
